        Parameters:
        extensions - - all file-extension that are allowed
        description - - a short description for the filter
        Returns:

      • isDirectoryWritable

        public static boolean isDirectoryWritable(java.io.File directory)

      • numFilesInDirectory

        public static int numFilesInDirectory(java.io.File directory)
        A function that counts the number of files in the given directory recursively. Each directory will be interpreted as file and will be counted too. So the function will return 1 at least if the given directory exists.
        Parameters:
        directory -
        Returns:
        - the number of files found in the given directory or 0 if the directory does not exist.

      • fileIsReadable

        public static boolean fileIsReadable(java.lang.String filename)
        Returns true if the file (no directory) is readable. The method returns false if:
        • the given reference parameter is null
        • the given file does not exist
        • the given file is an directory
        • the given file is not readable
        Parameters:
        file -
        Returns:

      • fileIsReadable

        public static boolean fileIsReadable(java.io.File file)
        Returns true if the file (no directory) is readable. The method returns false if:
        • the given reference parameter is null
        • the given file does not exist
        • the given file is an directory
        • the given file is not readable
        Parameters:
        file -
        Returns:

      • fileIsWritable

        public static boolean fileIsWritable(java.io.File file)
        Returns true if the given file is writable. Returns false if:
        • the given parameter file is null
        • the given file is not writable
        • the given file is an directory
        Parameters:
        file -
        Returns:

      • addFileExtension

        public static java.lang.String addFileExtension(java.lang.String filePath,
                                java.lang.String extension)
        Adds the given extension to the file given in the file-path, but only if the extension is missing.
        Parameters:
        filePath -
        extension - - pure extension without a '.' separator
        Returns:

      • strToWinFilename

        public static java.lang.String strToWinFilename(java.lang.String str,
                                java.lang.String replacemetForIllegalCharacters)
        Replaces all character that are not allowed in a correct filename for Windows with the given replacement. The following characters will be replaced:
        • "
        • \
        • /
        • :
        • *
        • ?
        • <
        • >
        Parameters:
        str - - the String that might contain illegal characters
        replacemetForIllegalCharacters - - the replacement (if the given replacement contains illegal characters, is null or of length 0 the default replacement '_' will be used instead.)
        Returns:
